experience.title: The Burning Reef
experience.description: My final project dissertation for Digital Media at UWE. An interactive narative driven audio-visual experience for the web, generated using Three.JS to procedurally generate the dynamic environment. The project is an exploration into the effects of a dynamic ambience that demonstrates the effects of ocean degradation to elicit an emotional response while the user explores and collects artefacts related to the main causes of the degradation. Effectiveness of the project was validated by qualitative user research and testing.
experience.roles: Javascript Developer, 3D Artist, User Experience Designer

experience.title: Critical Eye

Critical Eye: Visual Archives for Education will provide a platform for schools and museums to use for education through the use of guides and a visual archive of user responses. My responsibilities also included providing user research, design research and branding feedback for use by the IC: Visual Labs Team.

experience.title: SAM-APP for Anxiety
experience.description: Creating short animations in CSS and the Adobe Creative Suite that are then implemented into the SAM-App, ensuring compatibility while following the brand styling guidelines of the app, which is designed to encourage positive mental health habits. Using JavaScript, HTML and CSS to develop multiple short interactive animated app pages and minigames that can be used for meditation and unwinding mental fatigue.

experience.title: Communicare
experience.description: A collaboration mobile app project, creating a social media platform for use by people in care to meet and interact with others in the facility. Prototype made in Invision, documentation and client presentation made with MS Office. User Research took place including interviews of the general public to assist forming user journey maps and personas.

experience.title: LIVE FEED
experience.description: A piece of Speculation design aiming to explore how the ownership of media portraying poverty might change given the creation of a system that would give control of the portrayal to those actually in poverty. A 3D interface streaming booth setup in a foodbank and an accompanying app prototype made in Figma allows those in poverty to safely present themselves to the general public through a media streaming platform

experience.title: DIVE

experience.title: Star Skimmer
experience.description: A short endless space exploration web game developed in Javascript using the P5.JS library with custom sounds and original sound track.

experience.title: Carbon Visualisation
experience.description: A data visualisation project created to visualise the varying carbon dioxide levels in the UK by retrieving values from a realtime API. The project also allows users to log their routine in travelling by road in order to collate all the results from all users throughout the day and see any potential correlation.

experience.title: Echo Architect
experience.description: An interactive game encouraging playful connections through the use of a puzzle-like interface where users must guess the code by identifying individual elements of a soundtrack. Made as an internet of Things project combining Arduino hardware for a physical interface and Javascript and ReactJS for the software interface. The project was aided by research in which we conducted user interviews on the types of interactions and genres of music users would find more enjoyable.
